lines.text: I can understand someone wanting to steal a pair of boots - but one? So there it is.
Do you imagine that I can prevent the Powers of Darkness?
This is, I think, a two-pipe problem.
My professional charges are upon a fixed scale. I do not vary them, except when I remit them altogether.
Let loose the pack!
Let the hounds of Hell take me if I can't track her down!
But this is remarkable!
Superficial. There is nothing remarkable about using one's eyes.
[to Sir Henry Baskerville]
I must insist upon one thing. Under no circumstances are you to go out onto the moors at night.
Elementary, my dear Watson. Tarantulas are not from South Africa.
[last lines]
It's elementary, my dear Watson, elementary...
[Extending it to Watson]
Muffin?
Thank you.
I never relinquish a case!
What do you expect to find down here, Mr. Holmes?
What one expects to find under the ground. Bones, perhaps?
[introducing himself]
Bishop of the Upper Isles... for what they're worth.
There is more evil around us here than I have ever encountered before.
[of Sir Henry Baskerville]
I warned him! What could have possessed him to come out here alone?
We shall avenge his death, not mourn it.
The depth a human being can sink to!
[on meeting Dr. Watson]
I knew a Watson once, a white slaver...
In a case such as this, everyone is suspect - even Sir Henry.
The dagger's gone! Don't you realize what that means? Sir Henry is to die tonight!
The Curse of the Hound is on you!
The powers of Evil can take many forms. Remember that, Sir Henry, when you're at Baskerville Hall. Do as the legend tells and avoid the moor when the forces of darkness are exalted.
When you're poor, no one wants to know you.
Sir Henry, keep perfectly still...
[Pointing to him]
if you value your life.
You had better be off. You mustn't be late for your peasant friends... I hope you enjoy their rabbit pie.
